channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Liverpool vs Aston Villa live stream: How to watch Premier League 2025/26, TV channels, broadcasters
item.description: All the ways to watch Liverpool vs Aston Villa live streams online and from anywhere as the Reds welcome Unai Emery's side to Anfield.
item.dc:creator: Sam May, TechRadar

item.title: Another major WordPress add-on security flaw could affect 10,000 sites - find out if you're affected
item.description: King Addons for Elementor allowed full WordPress website takeover through two critical-level vulnerabilities.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: Stop! Should you upgrade your M1 Max Apple Mac to the M5? GPU and memory bandwidth data reveal the surprising answer
item.description: Before upgrading from an M1 Max Mac to an M5 model, read how GPU count memory speed and AI processing shape real world results.
item.dc:creator: Wayne Williams, TechRadar

item.title: Your agents are not your friends
item.description: I keep seeing articles and conferences about “humanizing” AI in one way or another. And while I get the sentiment, I think they’re taking the wrong approach. There’s no point in making technologies more human. Being human is our job.
item.dc:creator: Douglas Rushkoff, Fast Company

item.title: How I ended up with 111,582 iPhone photos, and what I’m doing about it
item.description: Greetings and thank you once again for reading Fast Company’s Plugged In—and a happy Halloween to you. Recently, I used Apple Photos to revisit the photos I took during the 2015 Thanksgiving holiday. There were some gems in there—memories I’d like to preserve forever.
item.dc:creator: Harry McCracken, Fast Company

item.title: AI buildout cements its role as a global catalyst this week
item.description: A momentous week in the technology sector made it clear there is no sign the boom in building artificial intelligence infrastructure is slowing — despite the bubble talk. Nvidia, whose processors are the AI revolution’s backbone, became the first company to surpass $5 trillion in market value.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, Fast Company

item.title: 6 new Apple TV+ movies and shows to watch in November 2025
item.description: Every new Apple TV+ movie and show being released throughout November 2025 that you need to know about.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Schwanke, TechRadar

item.title: Trump admin begins developing new cybersecurity strategy
item.description: Sean Cairncross, the national cyber director, said he's looking to improve U.S. cyber strategy efforts by working with the private sector. The post Trump admin begins developing new cybersecurity strategy first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Justin Doubleday, Federal News Network

item.title: Nvidia announces AI partnership with South Korea’s government, Samsung and Hyundai
item.description: Silicon Valley chipmaker Nvidia plans to supply hundreds of thousands of its graphics processing units for projects with South Korean businesses and the government to advance the country’s artificial intelligence infrastructure and technologies.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Nearly 58 billion personal data points have been leaked online since 2004, new study reveals
item.description: Your digital life is more exposed than you think. A new study from security firm Surfshark has quantified the astonishing scale of data breaches since 2004, revealing that tens of billions of personal data points, from passwords to physical addresses, are now in the wild.
item.dc:creator: Rene Millman, TechRadar

item.title: Windows 10 users face ransomware nightmare as Microsoft support ends in 2025 worldwide
item.description: Microsoft warns Windows 10 users face serious security risks as 90% of ransomware attacks target unsupported systems. Learn why upgrading to Windows 11 is crucial.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Bill Gates is just plain wrong about climate change
item.description: Bill Gates has invested billions over the last two decades to help fight climate change. But in a new blog post, he argues that world is too focused on cutting short-term emissions.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: Nvidia chief still hopes to sell Blackwell chips to China
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang still hopes to sell chips from the company's Blackwell lineup to customers in China, though he has no current plans to do so, he told reporters Friday.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: Meta defies AI spending gloom with record-breaking bond sale
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. found record-shattering demand for its bond sale on Thursday even as its shares plunged, in a sign that bond investors are looking past any concerns about its artificial-intelligence spending plans.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: It was the hottest thing in climate tech. Now it’s trapped in the valley of death
item.description: A year ago, direct air capture—technology that pulls CO2 from the air—seemed ready to quickly scale in the U.S. Project Cypress, a massive undertaking in Louisiana designed to capture more than a million tons of CO2 each year, won $50 million in funding from the Department of Energy in early 2024.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: ABC, ESPN go dark on YouTube TV amid carrier dispute with Disney
item.description: Disney-owned networks like ABC and ESPN were taken off YouTube TV's channel offerings overnight as the two sides work to reach a new agreement on broadcast rights.
item.dc:creator: Dominick Mastrangelo, The Hill

item.title: OpenAI preps models to replace banking, consulting jobs
item.description: OpenAI’s decision to train its models on the everyday outputs of consultants and bankers is more than just a technical experiment, it’s a signal that AI is being repositioned from a generic tool to a domain-capable resource, Sanchit Vir Gogia, the chief analyst, founder and CEO of Greyhound Research
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Rust 1.91 promotes Windows on Arm64 to Tier 1 target
item.description: The Rust Release Team has released Rust 1.91, an update of the popular memory-safe programming language that promotes Windows on Arm64 platform to a Tier 1 supported target. Rust 1.91 was announced October 30. Previous users can upgrade by running rustup update stable.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Strengthening security with a converged security and networking platform
item.description: Today’s IT environment of multiple clouds, hybrid work, and the exploding popularity of AI has given cybercriminals unprecedented opportunities for launching attacks — and the traditional arsenal of tools organizations use to stop them isn’t working.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Canva debuts foundational ‘design’ model, extends AI tools across its app
item.description: Canva has built its own foundational AI model that generates layered designs users can edit more easily. It’s one of several generative AI-related features Canva announced Thursday, alongside expanded access to its AI assistant and content generation capabilities across its app.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump, Xi didn't discuss Taiwan, Russian oil nor Blackwell chips
item.description: President Trump said the issues of Taiwan, Russian oil and Nvidia's advanced Blackwell chip weren't raised during his wide-ranging meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea on Thursday. “Taiwan never came up.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, The Hill

item.title: AWS opens giant data center for AI training
item.description:
Just over a year after construction began, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has opened its giant data center near Lake Michigan in Indiana.
The data center, which is part of AWS Project Rainier, covers 1,200 acres, or 4.86 square kilometers.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Key principles of a successful internal developer platform
item.description: Modern software delivery is a story of increasing complexity. As organizations adopt cloud-native technologies, the number of tools, APIs, and processes keeps multiplying.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Unit testing Spring MVC applications with JUnit 5
item.description: Spring is a reliable and popular framework for building web and enterprise Java applications. In this article, you’ll learn how to unit test each layer of a Spring MVC application, using built-in testing tools from JUnit 5 and Spring to mock each component’s dependencies.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Trump Media entering predictive market space
item.description: Parent company Trump Media announced a partnership to allow users to trade predictive contracts on events.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Tech companies break records, spending more money than ever on lobbying the EU
item.description: Major US tech companies are spending more money than ever lobbying the EU to influence its digital rules, Politico reports. Artificial intelligence and rules such as the Digital Markets Act (DMA) and the Digital Services Act (DSA) will be a particular focus.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: EPA deepens work with water sector amid rising cyber concerns
item.description: The EPA’s work to identify vulnerabilities in the water sector will be a critical piece of its efforts as the risk management agency for water utilities. The post EPA deepens work with water sector amid rising cyber concerns first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Justin Doubleday, Federal News Network

item.title: Amazon laying off 14,000 corporate jobs amid AI push
item.description: Amazon said Tuesday that it is cutting about 14,000 corporate roles as the e-commerce giant expands its investment in AI.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: New military age demands new C2 comms
item.description: As purposely scattered forces replace massing, all units need access to rich and latency-free crucial situational data regardless of from where they operate. The post New military age demands new C2 comms first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Tom Temin, Federal News Network
